page.title: 03CHERTSEY HALL
page.content: The new Chertsey Hall, which was purpose designed, was officially opened on l6th January l982 by the Mayor of Runnymede, Councillor D.T. Clarke. Its main hall is equipped with a stage, a cinema screen and a sound control room. The auditorium can seat more than three hundred people. The projection equipment used for showing films was purchased with money from the Chertsey Town Municipal Fund. There are four other meeting rooms of varying size as well as a kitchen, bar and cloakroom. The Hall is used for wedding receptions, dinner/dances, professional and amateur theatre and concerts, dance and keep-fit classes, major public inquiries, exhibitions, old peoples clubs, antique and toy fairs and meetings of local clubs.
